title: Mass conservation - speed in toy water launcher

content.question: A cylindrical toy water launcher has an interior radius <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>. There is a plunger at the end of the cylinder that can be pushed inward, causing water to exit through a small circular opening with radius <math alttext="lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math>, where <math alttext="lowercase r is less than uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi><mo><</mo><mi>R</mi></math>. When the toy is held horizontally with its center located a distance <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math> above the ground and the plunger is compressed at a speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>, the stream of water travels a horizontal distance <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> before reaching the ground, as shown. Which of the following expressions is equal to the speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="x times the square root of the fraction g over 2 h, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><msqrt><mfrac><mi>g</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>h</mi></mrow></mfrac></msqrt></math>

<math alttext="x times, open parenthesis, the fraction uppercase R squared over lowercase r squared, end fraction, close parenthesis, times the square root of the fraction g over 2 h, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><msqrt><mfrac><mi>g</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>h</mi></mrow></mfrac></msqrt></math>

<math alttext="x times, open parenthesis, the fraction lowercase r squared over uppercase R squared, end fraction, close parenthesis, times the square root of the fraction g over 2 h, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><msqrt><mfrac><mi>g</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>h</mi></mrow></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x times, open parenthesis, the fraction lowercase r squared over uppercase R squared, end fraction, close parenthesis, times the square root of the fraction 2 h over g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>h</mi></mrow><mi>g</mi></mfrac></msqrt></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="x times, open parenthesis, the fraction lowercase r squared over uppercase R squared, end fraction, close parenthesis, times the square root of the fraction g over 2 h, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><msqrt><mfrac><mi>g</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>h</mi></mrow></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
